properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 10:17AM EST until February 8 at 11:10AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers
in South Carolina...


Saluda River At West Pelzer affecting Anderson and Greenville
Counties.
Saluda River Near Greenville affecting Greenville and Pickens
Counties.



.Runoff from previous heavy rain will result in the river remaining
above flood stage.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Saluda River Near Greenville.
* until Saturday morning.
...Flood Warning extended until Saturday morning...
* At  8:45 AM Friday the stage was 15.9 feet. The river crested
at 8:45 AM this morning.
* Minor Flood Stage is 9.5 feet.
* Moderate flood stage is 13.0 feeet.
* Major flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Major flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* FORECAST: The river is cresting and will fall to below Minor Flood
Stage tonight.
* Impact...At 15.0 feet...Most homes between the river and riverdale
drive and riverdale circle will be flooded. Flooding at this level
will be similar to the flooding that occurred on september 9, 2004.
Major flooding occurrs.
* Impact...At 14.0 feet...Homes along old easly bridge road and along
fish trap road and shady acres areas will be flooded. +
* Impact...At 13.0 feet...Homes on riverview circle will be flooded.
Most of riverview circle and parts of riverview drive will be
flooded. Back water on georges creek will cause water to appraoch
homes in quail haven subdivision in pickens county. Moderate
flooding occurrs.
* Impact...At 11.5 feet...Homes will be surrounded by water on
riverview circle south of highway 123 and parts of riverview drive
will begin to flood. +
* Impact...At 10.5 feet...The river will surround homes south of
highway 123 on riverview circle. Evacuations in pickens county in
the shady acres trailer park area near fish trap road and along old
easley bridge road near highway 123 will begin. +
* Impact...At 9.5 feet...Evacuations on the pickens county side of
the river north and south of old easley bridge road will likely
begin. Homes will be threatened in the shady acres subdivision
especially along ron lane and in the 3900 to 4100 block of old
easley bridge road. +
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp

Please report high water...flooding and landslides to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free...1...8 0
0...2 6 7...8 1 0 1...or by posting on our Facebook page...or tweet
it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and
the specific location where it occurred.
